conclusion: Object A is released and drops straight down under gravity.
Object A hits the beige cloth, stretches it, then continues until it meets the two blocks already under that cloth (C above D).
After a short bounce, Object A settles, so the left stack from bottom to top is: D (red), C (blue), A.
Object B is released at the same time.
Object B falls onto the blue cloth on the right, stretches that cloth, and then contacts the two blocks underneath (E above F).
Object B loses its remaining kinetic energy and comes to rest, giving the right-hand stack: F (brown), E (dark grey), B.
Both cloths finish draped over their three-block stacks, held in place by the pins at their corners.

Final result: A ends up resting on the pair C–D under the beige cloth, and B ends up resting on the pair E–F under the blue cloth; nothing moves any farther once all three-block piles have come to rest.
